name: SEC Index Publishing
description: Regulatory requirements for index methodology documents submitted to the SEC for daily index publishing

policies.name: Methodology Description
policies.description: Document must contain a clear description of the index calculation methodology

validation_rules.error_message: Document must include a methodology section

policies.ai_prompt_template: Verify this document contains a clear, complete description of how the index is calculated. Check for: formula definitions, variable explanations, and step-by-step calculation procedures.

policies.name: Component Selection Criteria
policies.description: Must define how index components (securities) are selected

validation_rules.error_message: Document must include component selection criteria

policies.ai_prompt_template: Verify this document explains how securities are selected for inclusion in the index. Look for: eligibility criteria, screening process, and selection rules.

policies.name: Rebalancing Rules
policies.description: Must specify when and how the index is rebalanced
policies.ai_prompt_template: Check that the document specifies: rebalancing frequency, trigger conditions for rebalancing, and the rebalancing procedure.

policies.name: Corporate Action Handling
policies.description: Should describe how corporate actions affect the index

validation_rules.error_message: Consider adding corporate action handling procedures

policies.ai_prompt_template: Evaluate whether the document addresses handling of corporate actions such as dividends, stock splits, mergers, and acquisitions.

policies.name: Data Sources
policies.description: Should identify data sources used for calculations
policies.ai_prompt_template: Check if the document identifies the sources of pricing data, corporate action data, and other inputs used in index calculations.

policies.name: Governance Structure
policies.description: May include information about index governance
policies.ai_prompt_template: Note whether the document includes governance information such as oversight committee, review processes, or conflict of interest policies.
